theoryTitle: Robin is Being Blackmailed, Not Actually Betraying the Crew
theoryText: Many fans theorized after Episode 239 that Robin didn't actually betray the Straw Hats willingly. The fact that Iceburg tearfully wants to see her again suggests there's more to the story. Fans speculated that Robin might be under duress or being blackmailed to protect the crew from a greater threat.
author: One Piece fan community (2005-2006)

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory was confirmed in later episodes when Robin's true motivations were revealed

popularity.supportEvidence: Iceburg's emotional reaction and Robin's past suggest hidden motivations
popularity.debunkEvidence: Theory was later confirmed to be correct

theoryTitle: The Masked Man is One of the Galley-La Foremen
theoryText: Some fans theorized that the mysterious masked man who attacked Iceburg alongside Robin was actually one of the Galley-La foremen, possibly Kaku or Lucci. The irony of them attacking Luffy while being the actual perpetrators seemed too deliberate to be coincidental.
author: One Piece fan community (2005)

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory was confirmed when CP9 identities were revealed

popularity.supportEvidence: The masked attacker's build and the dramatic irony of the foremen attacking Luffy
popularity.debunkEvidence: Theory was confirmed correct - it was CP9 agents Lucci and Kaku

theoryTitle: Iceburg Knows More Than He's Letting On
theoryText: Fans speculated that Iceburg's emotional request to see Robin again suggests he understands her true situation and motivations. Rather than simply being a victim, Iceburg might know why Robin attacked him and wants to help or forgive her.
author: One Piece fan community (2005)

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory partially confirmed - Iceburg knew about the Pluton blueprints and CP9's involvement

popularity.supportEvidence: Iceburg's tearful reaction and emotional plea to see Robin suggests compassion rather than anger
popularity.debunkEvidence: Later revealed that Iceburg knew about Pluton and CP9's true goal

theoryTitle: The Aqua Laguna Will Play a Major Role in the Arc's Climax
theoryText: With the Aqua Laguna being introduced as a major threat and time constraint in Episode 239, fans theorized it would become a crucial element in the arc's climax, possibly affecting battles or forcing difficult decisions about escape routes.
author: One Piece fan community (2005)

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory confirmed - Aqua Laguna became a major factor in the arc's events

popularity.supportEvidence: The deliberate introduction and emphasis on the Aqua Laguna as a time constraint

theoryTitle: Kalifa's Suspicious Behavior Hints at Betrayal
theoryText: Some observant fans noticed that Kalifa allowed Luffy to reach Iceburg's room while lying to other shipwrights about his whereabouts. This suspicious behavior led to theories that Kalifa might be working against Galley-La's interests or with the mysterious attackers.
author: Observant One Piece fans (2005)

spoilerStatus.spoilerDescription: Theory confirmed when Kalifa was revealed as a CP9 agent

popularity.supportEvidence: Kalifa's deliberate deception in allowing Luffy through while lying to colleagues
popularity.debunkEvidence: Theory confirmed - Kalifa was a CP9 undercover agent
